body_html:
Should we close this since there is already torch.zeros() for sparse tensor? @zou3519 @SsnL

a = torch.zeros((3, 3), layout=torch.sparse_coo, requires_grad=True)
print(a)
----------------
torch.sparse.FloatTensor of size (3,3) with indices:
tensor([], dtype=torch.int64, grad_fn=<Error>)
and values:
tensor([], grad_fn=<Error>)

body:
Should we close this since there is already torch.zeros() for sparse tensor? @zou3519 @SsnL 

```
a = torch.zeros((3, 3), layout=torch.sparse_coo, requires_grad=True)
print(a)
----------------
torch.sparse.FloatTensor of size (3,3) with indices:
tensor([], dtype=torch.int64, grad_fn=<Error>)
and values:
tensor([], grad_fn=<Error>)
```
